GAME().notice: The `FaultDisputeGame` proxy that the `GameSolver` will be solving.

agreeWithRoot().notice: Signals whether or not the `GameSolver` agrees with the root claim of the         `GAME` contract.

l2Outputs(uint256).notice: The L2 outputs that the `GameSolver` will be representing, keyed by L2 block number - 1.

processedBuf().notice: The offset of previously processed claims in the `GAME` contract's `claimData` array.         Starts at 0 and increments by 1 for each claim processed.

solveGame().notice: Returns an array of `Move`s that can be taken from the perspective of an honest         actor in the `FaultDisputeGame` contract.

trace().notice: The execution trace that the `GameSolver` will be representing.

GAME().notice: The `FaultDisputeGame` proxy that the `GameSolver` will be solving.

agreeWithRoot().notice: Signals whether or not the `GameSolver` agrees with the root claim of the         `GAME` contract.

l2Outputs(uint256).notice: The L2 outputs that the `GameSolver` will be representing, keyed by L2 block number - 1.

processedBuf().notice: The offset of previously processed claims in the `GAME` contract's `claimData` array.         Starts at 0 and increments by 1 for each claim processed.

solveGame().notice: Returns an array of `Move`s that can be taken from the perspective of an honest         actor in the `FaultDisputeGame` contract.

trace().notice: The execution trace that the `GameSolver` will be representing.

userdoc.notice: The `GameSolver` contract is a contract that can produce an array of available         moves for a given `FaultDisputeGame` contract, from the eyes of an honest         actor. The `GameSolver` does not implement functionality for acting on the `Move`s         it suggests.

documentation.text: @notice The `FaultDisputeGame` proxy that the `GameSolver` will be solving.
@notice The split depth of the game
@notice The max depth of the game

@notice The maximum L2 block number that the output bisection portion of the position tree
         can handle.
@notice The L2 outputs that the `GameSolver` will be representing, keyed by L2 block number - 1.
@notice The execution trace that the `GameSolver` will be representing.
@notice The raw absolute prestate data.

@notice The offset of previously processed claims in the `GAME` contract's `claimData` array.
         Starts at 0 and increments by 1 for each claim processed.

@notice Signals whether or not the `GameSolver` agrees with the root claim of the
         `GAME` contract.

@notice Returns an array of `Move`s that can be taken from the perspective of an honest
         actor in the `FaultDisputeGame` contract.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) pure returns (struct GameSolver.Move memory[] memory)
function (struct IFaultDisputeGame.ClaimData memory) view returns (enum HonestGameSolver.Direction,Position)

documentation.text:
@notice Returns an array of `Move`s that can be taken from the perspective of an honest
         actor in the `FaultDisputeGame` contract.
@dev Helper function to determine the direction of the next move to be taken.

@dev Helper function to get the `ClaimData` struct at a given index in the `GAME` contract's
      `claimData` array.
@notice Returns the mock output at the given position.
@notice Returns the mock output at the given L2 block number.
@notice Returns the player's claim that commits to a given trace index.
@notice Returns the player's claim that commits to a given trace index.
@notice Returns the state at the trace index within the player's trace.
@notice Returns the state at the trace index within the player's trace.

@notice Returns whether or not the position is on a level which opposes the local opinion of the
         root claim.
@notice The `GameSolver` contract used to determine the moves to be taken.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (contract FaultDisputeGame,uint256[] memory,bytes memory,bytes memory) returns (contract HonestGameSolver)
function () external returns (struct GameSolver.Move memory[] memory)
